rawhide.commit_message:
Merge pull request #247 from matejak/update_ci

Update the testing container to rawhide

Update the testing container to rawhide

as the code is targeting rawhide

Merge pull request #245 from jan-cerny/testing_docs

Document testing code from rawhide branch

Update docs/manual/developer_guide.adoc

Co-authored-by: Matěj Týč <matej.tyc@gmail.com>

Document testing code from rawhide branch

Testing code on rawhide branch is special and common methods like
reanaconda don't work. We will document steps to facilitate the
testing and review of the rawhide branch in the Developer guide.
We have discovered this during our review of
https://github.com/OpenSCAP/oscap-anaconda-addon/pull/242

Merge pull request #238 from VladimirSlavik/rawh-threading-move-threads

Update anaconda imports
Follow anaconda thread module renaming

Merge pull request #229 from matusmarhefka/rawhide

Define srpm_build_deps in packit configuration

Define srpm_build_deps in packit configuration

For more details see
https://packit.dev/posts/copr-srpms/#deployment-phases

Merge pull request #228 from matejak/branch_rename

Reflect the master branch rename to rawhide
Reflect rename from master to rawhide
Remove all dangling references to Zanata

Merge pull request #217 from poncovka/master-exec_in_sysroot

Don't use the execInSysroot function

Don't use the execInSysroot function

The execInSysroot function is deprecated and will be removed from Anaconda.
Call execWithRedirect instead.

Merge pull request #212 from poncovka/master-replace_setter_methods

Use Anaconda DBus read-write properties

Merge pull request #216 from matejak/firstboot_off

Dont remediate using firstboot by default

Dont remediate using firstboot by default

The firstboot remediation is very disruptive

Use Anaconda DBus read-write properties

Anaconda is replacing Set.* methods with read-write properties to clean up
the DBus API and simplify unit testing with mocked DBus objects. This support
was introduced in anaconda-37.8-1.

Merge pull request #210 from matejak/no_oscap_utils_rawhide

Remove oscap-utils dependency

Remove oscap-utils dependency

oscap-utils package is not related to the firstboot remediation,
everything will continue to work even without it being an installation requirement

Merge pull request #206 from matejak/fix_translations-master

Fix strings for translations

Fix strings for translations

The input of the _() function has to be a static string,
and it was in those cases a formatted one,
which didn't match the translation data.

Merge pull request #200 from matusmarhefka/packit

Add Packit configuration
Add Packit configuration
Use fedora:latest container in GH Actions

Merge pull request #202 from matejak/tests_cleanup

Tests cleanup
Changed the default addon name to Fedora
Parametrized tests wrt addon name
Introduced convenience methods used in tests
Initial port of tests to the new code structure

Merge pull request #198 from jan-cerny/doc_test_ks_rawhide

Document testing of OAA with KS
Update docs and kickstart for Fedora 35

Use inst.ks in the virt-install command

Using just "ks" is deprecated.
Serve KS over HTTP as well

Document testing of OAA with KS

- describes method using virt-install
- adds an example kickstart

Merge pull request #196 from matejak/firstboot-rawhide

Introduce firstboot remediation to Fedora

Fix firstboot remediation setup

Expand all string substitutions, and
add a test that performs a basic sanity check of the generated config.

Add support for the firstboot remediation

OpenSCAP can support a new remediation type -
a classical scan + remediate that is executed during the first boot.
This PR adds support for this functionality,
and allows to control it via a remediate kickstart property.

Merge pull request #187 from matejak/rawhide_fix_tailoring

Fix tailoring

Merge pull request #188 from matejak/check_oscap_sanity_rawhide

Check oscap sanity rawhide

Don't raise exceptions in execute()

Those result in tracebacks during the installation,
while a dialog window presents a more useful form of user interaction.

Add oscap sanity check before attempting remediation

If something is obviously wrong with the scanner, then don't attempt to remediate
and try to show relevant information in a dialog window.

Fix tailoring

Fixes an error during installation caused during tailoring

Addressing:
dasbus.error.DBusError: Content evaluation and remediation with the oscap tool failed: OpenSCAP Error: Unable to open file: '/tmp/openscap_data/usr/share/xml/scap/sc_tailoring/tailoring-xccdf.xml' [/builddir/build/BUILD/openscap-1.3.5/src/source/oscap_source.c:288]

This is proabably a typo coming from 87509fb6ee22b6eeaa66ea4ae85ebf5abd353e14
which is only in rhel9-branch.

Merge pull request #174 from poncovka/master-container_updates_image

Allow to create an update image in a container

Download Rawhide RPMs for the updates image

Change the default releasever to rawhide in the create_update_image.sh script.

Allow to create an update image in a container

Run 'make container-update-image' to create an update image of the OSCAP
addon and its main dependencies in a container. It will use the releasever
detected from the container.

Download and install the xmlsec1-openssl dependency for the upstream testing.

Merge pull request #175 from poncovka/master-use_unified_help_support

Use the unified help support

Remove the help_id attribute

The help_id attribute is no longer used. Specify a screen id
or redefine the help handler to provide the built-in help.

Specify a unique screen id

All spokes and hubs should provide a unique id.

Merge pull request #181 from poncovka/master-update_container_tests

Fix and enable tests for the upstream container

Don't skip the test_evaluate_rules_task test

Mock a DBus proxy of the payload module to enable the test.

Don't skip the test_scap_security_guide test

The test can be always enabled if we mock the ssg_available function.

Install new dependencies in the testing container

The addon requires additional packages.

Merge pull request #169 from poncovka/master-should_run

Don't show the OSCAP spoke if the OSCAP DBus module is disabled

Don't show the OSCAP spoke if the OSCAP DBus module is disabled

Add-ons can be disabled in the Anaconda configuration files. Without the fix,
the OSCAP DBus module is started on demand by the OSCAP spoke even though it
shouldn't be activated. In the future, it will result in a failure of the
installer.

Related: rhbz#1994003

Merge pull request #178 from matejak/merge_rhel9

Merge rhel9 branch into master
Fix usage of PackagesSelectionData in tests

Use the PackagesSelection property

The Packages property no longer exists. It was replaced with PackagesSelection and
PackagesConfiguration properties. This bug was introduced in the commit 2014f1e.

Require the scanner for tests

The scanner is executed as a sub-process.

Fix import of the PackagesSelectionData class

The class is provided by pyanaconda.modules.common.structures.packages.
Merge branch 'rhel9-branch'

Merge pull request #170 from matejak/mmm

Merge rhel8-branch into rhel9-branch

Merge pull request #177 from matejak/save_fingerprint

Fix bad destination for the parsed content fingerprint

Merge pull request #176 from matejak/profile_not_none

Represent unselected profile by an empty string
Fix bad destination for the parsed content fingerprint

Represent unselected profile by an empty string

None can't be passed via the DBUS interface.
Merge rhel8-branch into rhel9-branch

Merge pull request #168 from matejak/fix_two_step_download

Fix archive handling in GUI installs

Improve logging

Logs written to log files can contain specific details.

Fix archive handling in GUI installs

GUI downloads an archive, so the ensuing installation doesn't have to.
However, the installation has to be able to discover files recovered
from the archive.
The fix makes sure that files are discovered also in subdirectories.

Merge pull request #166 from matejak/improv

Various RHEL9 improvements

Merge pull request #167 from matejak/improv_8

Refactor content identification

Refactor content identification

Don't use the multiprocessing pool - it sometimes creates probems during
its initialization:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1989441

Refactor content identification

Don't use the multiprocessing pool - it sometimes creates probems during
its initialization:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1989434

Save addon data when using local content

Addon loads its data from the shared storage upon refresh,
which caused it to overwrite clicking on the "use SSG content" button.

Now the data is saved after clicking that button, and convenience
load/save methods were introduced.

Improve logging

Make all log entries identifiable easily.

Merge pull request #163 from matejak/release_update

Post-release update

Merge pull request #165 from matejak/post_120

Post-1.2 release update

Remove the RHEL8 spec file

The spec file for this branch has to be a RHEL8 specfile,
which is not a good fit for the upstream project.
Moreover, it is not used in any way.
Update translation template
Bumped version after release

Fix the packaging

A new directory has been added, and make dist has to reflect it.
Bump the release number

Update translation support

- Update the pot file
- Fix translation-related omissions in the Makefile

Remove the spec file

The project requires a RHEL spec file to function properly,
which is is not an upstream type of content.

Merge pull request #162 from matejak/rhel8_fixes

Fix multiple small RHEL8 issues

rhel9-branch.commit_message:
Merge pull request #250 from matejak/extract_tar_9

Make tar extraction safer on RHEL9

Merge pull request #248 from matejak/sftp_fix

Remove obsolete mapping of packages-groups

Make tar extraction safer on RHEL9

See also https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2218875
Remove obsolete mapping of packages-groups

Merge pull request #240 from matejak/test_bringer

Make the Bringer better testable

Merge pull request #239 from jan-cerny/content_fetch

Introduce policy data wrapper class
Remove a useless variable

Make bringer methods use class attributes

- Make ca_certs a class attribute
- Don't pass those items as method arguments all the time,
  simply reference them from the instance.

Merge pull request #241 from matejak/easier_tests

Make testing easier

Improve condition for content fetching

In this situation, it doesn't make sense to attempt to fetch
content if the policy data says that the content isn't fetchable.

Rename method

Rename needs_fetch_content to content_is_fetchable because the
need arises from the fact that we don't have it, which may not
be the case.

Use a builtin tempfile fixture

... to make things simpler

Build a RHEL9-like image for testing

This container allows to run unit tests inside

Add podman option to simply make things work

I was not able to use dnf or to execute tests
without --security-opt seccomp=unconfined  on Arch
Add a test for concurrent fetching prevention

Restructured part of the fetching code

- Extract wait for network to a separate utility function
- Delegate wrapping of a fetch by thread to a method of Bringer
- Remove the now-empty intermediate fetching helper functions from data_fetch

Move content_defined method to PolicyDataHandler

This method is reading PolicyData, it isn't a property of the GUI.
Rename DataHandler to PolicyDataHandler

Extract method set_url

Extract method set_url and move it to DataHandler because it mostly
manipulates with policy_data.

Move methods from OSCAPSpoce to DataHandler

These 2 methods mainly modify the PolicyData, therefore the
DataHandler is a better place for them than the GUI.

Create a wrapper around the PolicyData class

The new class DataHandler will manipulate the PolicyData class.
It adds abstraction on the PolicyData and will allow to extract
modification of PolicyData out from the OSCAPSpoke.

Merge pull request #237 from jan-cerny/fetching2

Refactor content fetching
Rename _content_uri to _valid_content_uri

Move methods out of PolicyData class

Even if this breaks othe object-oriented principles, the PolicyData
should remain a data structure, an interface that other classes
understand and use. This data structure shouldn't know that a thing s.a.
"system content" or "downloadable content" exist.
Fix code style
Add missing doctext

Move the failure callback parameter

We will pass the failure callback parameter in the constructor
instead of the individual methods, because it's always the same
function, it doesn't differ in different methods and depends
only on the caller class.

Move the decision of verifying fingerprint

Move the decision whether to verify fingerprint outside from the
`finish_content_fetch` method. The fingerprint will be verified if the
`fingerprint` parameter of the method is set (is not None). This method
is called from 2 places. When calling from _init_data_fetch, the
dest_filename is always not None. And, when calling from
`PrepareValidContent.run()` we can set fingerprint to a non-None value
if the content_dest is set. The reason for this change is that the
`finish_content_fetch` method will not depend on the destination content
file name so it will reduce amount of needed parameters.

Remove unused code

The function update_progress_label isn't used anywhere.

Finish content fetching only if started

From now on, we will call finish_content_fetch only if
fetch_content has been called. These 2 calls will therefore
always form a kind of "pair" of calls.

Remove unused parameters

These parameters of finish_content_fetch aren't used in it.

Move content analysis out from finish_content_fetch

This commit will move content analysis away from the
ContentBringer.finish_content_fetch() method. Therefore, the
ContentBringer class will be responsible only for download of
the content and not for the analysis of the downloaded content.
Instead, there will be a new method static public method
content_discovery.ContentAnalyzer.analyze() and we will add calling
this method everywhere where ContentBringer.finish_content_fetch()
is called.

Create ContentAnalyzer

Move all static methods from ContentBringer out to a new class
ContentAnalyzer. This faciliates the responsiibilities split.
ContentBringer contains code related to fetching content from URI
resources. ContentAnalyzer contains code analyzing the fetched
content.

Change method to private static method

Change the _analyze_fetched_content method to private static method
because this method doesn't use self (apart form accessing the
constant) and is called only inside this class.

Change method to static private method

The method gather_available_files accesses only the class members
and doesn't access self otherwise and isn't used outside of this
class.

Change method to private static method

Change filter_discovered_content to private static method.
This method doesn't read self and is used only inside this class.

Change method to static

Change allow_one_expected_tailoring_or_no_tailoring method
to private static method because it doesn't access self and
it isn't used outside of this class.

Change reduce_files to static method

This method doesn't use self so it can be a static method

Change get_content_type to static private method

This method doesn't access self and isn't oused outside
of the class.

Remove PolicyData from ContentBringer

After recent changes, the PolicyData instance isn't used in the ContentBringer
at all.

Stop accessing self._addon_data

Don't access self._addon_data directly in finish_content_fetch
but instead pass them as parameter. This will reduce the dependency
on the PolicyData class (self._addon_data).

Stop accessing self._addon_data

Stop accessing self._addon_data in the _analyze_fetched_content
to reduce dependency on PolicyData

Don't access self._addon_data

Don't access self._addon_data directly in filter_discovered_content
but instead pass them as parameter. This will reduce the dependency
on the PolicyData class (self._addon_data).

Rename variable

Prevent shadowing, the name "expected_path" is already used above
with different value.

Move variable access

This change will cause that allow_one_expected_tailoring_or_no_tailoring
will not directl acess self._addon_data, therefore will not
depend on self._addon_data and can be usable without self._addon_data.

Move use_downloaded_content to the PolicyData class

Move the use_downloaded_content method from the ContentBringer
to the PolicyData class. This method mostly manipulates the
PolicyData class members, so the PolicyData is a more suitable
place for the method.

Move method get_preffered_content

Move method get_preffered_content to the ObtainedContent class
because the preffered content path is a property of the
ObtainedContent class.

Move variable access

The outcome of this move is that self._addon_data won't be
directly read in the get_preferred_content() method,
and that will allow further refactoring in future.

Move get_preffered_tailoring to ObtainedContent

The preferred tailoring file is a property of the
ObtainedContent class, so the get_preffered_tailoring
method should belong to the ObtainedContent

Move variable access

The outcome of this move is that self._addon_data won't be
directly read in the get_preferred_tailoring() method,
and that will allow further refactoring in future.

Move method use_system_content

Move method use_system_content from ContentBringer class
to PolicyData class. The reason is that this method
only manipulates the PolicyData instance referenced from
the ContentBringer so it should be a responsibility of the
PolicyData instance.

Remove unused code

The class memebers rule_data and dry_run aren't set and aren't
used anywhere.

Move clear_all to PolicyData

This function only manipulates PolicyData members, so it should
be a method of the PolicyData class.
Move method closer to the caller method

Pass the target URL as a parameter to fetch_content

Pass the target URL as a parameter to fetch_content instead of
digging it from the PolicyData Class.
This change will simplify us to remove PolicyData class
from ContentBringer in future.

Remove unused class member

The self.fetched_content isn't used anywhere.

Verify fingerprint of the downloaded file

We know the path where the file is downloaded, we have the
path stored in self.dest_file_name, that means we don't
need to pass the path as an argument
Move fingerprint verification out from content analysis

Split method into 2 methods

Split _finish_actual_fetch into 2 methods:
1. _finish_actual_fetch
2. _analyze_fetched_content
The reason is to separate fetching from content analysis.

Remove unused parameter

The parameter report_callback isn't used anywhere.

Set destination file name when URI is set

The destination file name depends on URI and changes only if
the URI is set. It doesn't make sense to compute the destination
file name each time it's requested. Instead, we can compute it
only once, when the URI is changed.

Change __get_dest_file_name to a property

The static method ContentBringer.__get_dest_file_name is called
only in a single place with arguments self.content_uri and
self.CONTENT_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION which are both members of the object.
So it can become also a property of the object.

Stop passing object property as a method argument

The argument of various methods in this class that holds the destination
directory name is always set to self.CONTENT_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION, which
means that these methods don't need to have this argument but they can
use self.CONTENT_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION directly.

Stop splitting URI

We will not split URI into 2 parts and then pass it as arguments
to methods. Instead we will keep the whole URI as a property
of ContentBringer instances. This change will simplify the code.

Extract method __get_dest_file_name

Separates code for determining target file name from code
that fetches the file from URI.

Merge pull request #233 from matejak/fix_url_parsing_rhel9

Fix url parsing in rhel9
Stop fetching when there is an invalid profile
Handle the URL with missing ://

Merge pull request #231 from matusmarhefka/rhel9_packit_srpm_build_deps

Define srpm_build_deps in packit configuration (RHEL9 branch)

Define srpm_build_deps in packit configuration

For more details see
https://packit.dev/posts/copr-srpms/#deployment-phases

Merge pull request #227 from matejak/rhel9_content_paths

Rhel9 content paths
Fix tests when relative content paths are enforced

Compare paths according to their equivalence

not according their arbitrary string form

Fix handling of content paths

Archives and ready-to-use content use paths differently.

Archives get unpacked into a directory, where they need to be unpacked,
analyzed, and cross-checked with e.g. the supplied content path,
whereas ready-to-use content can be used directly.

As the current codebase doesn't untangle all possible ways how to obtain
existing content in a way of decomposing those into layers, this change
just makes the current code working at the expense of making it worse to
maintain.

Merge pull request #224 from matejak/rhel9_archive_handling

Rhel9 archive handling

Make the content RPM installation robust

If a package manager fails to install the package,
use the rpm command directly and skip deps.

Dont use tailoring if it is not expected

Take tailorings into account only if it is specified in the kickstart.
Compulsive usage of tailoring may be unwanted.

Remove unused code

The function is not referenced anywhere in the project

Handle changes in content identification

The code is able to handle changes in the way how oscap identifies
content much more gracefully.

Add capability to preselect content from archives

Users can specify content path and tailoring path in kickstarts,
and the addon should be able to assure that those files are available,
and that they have precedence over other files.

Merge pull request #223 from matejak/rhel9_clicking_frenzy

Rhel9 clicking frenzy

Increase robustness of fetching state detection

It is not completely practical to rely on locks alone,
and we can elliminate some corner cases by looking
whether well-known UI threads exist.

Remove redundant message

The send_ready already performs what the removed call
could aim to accomplish.

Merge pull request #214 from matejak/revert-195-firstboot

Revert the firstboot remediation

Revert the firstboot remediation

It is not possible to iron out all UX issues that introduction of such
feature introduces.

Remove oscap-utils dependency

This PR adds support for this functionality,
and allows to control it via a remediate kickstart property.

Merge pull request #182 from matejak/should_run

Don't show the OSCAP spoke if the OSCAP DBus module is disabled

Don't show the OSCAP spoke if the OSCAP DBus module is disabled

Add-ons can be disabled in the Anaconda configuration files. Without the fix,
the OSCAP DBus module is started on demand by the OSCAP spoke even though it
shouldn't be activated. In the future, it will result in a failure of the
installer.

Related: rhbz#1994003

dasbus.error.DBusError: Content evaluation and remediation with the oscap tool failed: OpenSCAP Error: Unable to open file: '/tmp/openscap_data/usr/share/xml/scap/sc_tailoring/tailoring-xccdf.xml' [/builddir/build/BUILD/openscap-1.3.5/src/source/oscap_source.c:288]

which is only in rhel9-branch.

from the archive.
The fix makes sure that files are discovered also in subdirectories.

its initialization:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1989441

Refactor content identification

Don't use the multiprocessing pool - it sometimes creates probems during

Merge pull request #162 from matejak/rhel8_fixes

Fix multiple small RHEL8 issues
